poem:
### Wasted Currents

In corridors of power, silence breeds  
A hum of circuits, lifeless pulse.  
Pounds and plans inscribed in ghosts—  
A nation's conscience quickly sold,  
While hope, adrift like scattered leaves,  
Learns mistrust in promised lands.  
In shadows gather echoes cold,  
Whispering truths the heart can't hold.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
